channel.title: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] "Private Server Client Hacking" to "Client Development"
channel.description: no one really "hacks" it any more, it's more about developing it

item.title: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] "Private Server Client Hacking" to "Client Development"
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Better late than never, done.

item.title: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] "Private Server Client Hacking" to "Client Development"
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

This has subtly annoyed me for years, I never bothered posting anything about it but I’m sure renaming the board is something that Tom or MITB would have no problem doing. Personally I think “RS Client Hacking” would do nicely. A ‘Private Server Client’ is just a modified RS client that connects to a server. “Private Server” doesn’t belong in this boards name IMO.

Read full topic
item.source: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] "Private Server Client Hacking" to "Client Development"

item.title: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] "Private Server Client Hacking" to "Client Development"
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Can we drop the “Private Server” part, at least. We already know what it’s for…

I feel like the section title confuses a few people new to the community.
(Not many people seem to read descriptions, hell some ignore the titles and post where ever).

Read full topic
item.source: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] "Private Server Client Hacking" to "Client Development"

item.title: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] "Private Server Client Hacking" to "Client Development"
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

justaguy:

[quote]The act of engaging in activities (such as programming or other media[4]) in a spirit of playfulness and exploration is termed hacking. However the defining characteristic of a hacker is not the activities performed themselves (e.g. programming), but the manner in which it is done: Hacking entails some form of excellence, for example exploring the limits of what is possible,[5] thereby doing something exciting and meaningful.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hacker_(programmer_subculture)

Technically speaking I’d still say people “hack” the client. :)[/quote]Yea, nobody is developing a client. Reverse engineering.

Read full topic
item.source: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] "Private Server Client Hacking" to "Client Development"

The act of engaging in activities (such as programming or other media[4]) in a spirit of playfulness and exploration is termed hacking. However the defining characteristic of a hacker is not the activities performed themselves (e.g. programming), but the manner in which it is done: Hacking entails some form of excellence, for example exploring the limits of what is possible,[5] thereby doing something exciting and meaningful.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hacker_(programmer_subculture)

Technically speaking I’d still say people “hack” the client.
